alert.note: Alert for Southwest Wyoming (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 21 at 3:03PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Rich and northwestern Uinta Counties through 345 PM MDT... At 303 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Woodruff, or 12 miles south of Randolph, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Randolph and Woodruff. This includes Utah Route 30 between mile markers 132 and 135. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A severe thunderstorm watch remains in effect until 800 PM MDT for northern Utah...and southwestern Wyoming.
